function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Data collection from Twitter may include biased samples and may not represent the entire population's attitudes towards noise","Impact":"Inaccurate representation of public attitudes towards noise complaints","Mitigation":"Use multiple data sources for a more comprehensive understanding of public attitudes towards noise","Technologies":"Data analytics and sentiment analysis tools for social media data","People":"General public","Owner":"Research team"},{"Description":"Comparison of attitudes towards noise before and during the lockdown may not account for external factors that influence noise perception","Impact":"Misinterpretation of the impact of the lockdown on human responses to noise","Mitigation":"Consider external factors such as seasonal variations and events in the comparison of attitudes towards noise","Technologies":"Data analytics and statistical modeling","People":"Research team","Owner":"Research team"},{"Description":"Data collection and analysis rely on social media, which may not capture the attitudes of individuals who do not use social media platforms","Impact":"Exclusion of non-social media users' attitudes towards noise","Mitigation":"Supplement social media data with other survey methods to capture a more comprehensive range of attitudes towards noise","Technologies":"Survey tools and data analytics for survey data","People":"Non-social media users","Owner":"Research team"}]}
